Articles.Content:
There was a mod way back when for TARDIS parts that no longer works, to my knowledge... So, I decided to grab some stock parts and try to re-make a TARDIS, and I think I did a pretty accurate job, according to some associates of mine. Oh, by the way, it's the Time And Relative Dimension Around Kerbin... TARDAK.

WAZZAT? HUOWWOUHSSHSHSHHOUSUSHOWOUSHSHSHS

ahauhauhuahuahuhauhaa

Dr. Who!

I love this Series
Nicely done! Is it manned or probe-driven? Might be possible to make a 2.5m version with a landercan with custom kerbals inside.
So how about some IVA? Is it bigger on the inside?

This is what the inside looks like. It uses the square probe at the bottom. The only non-stock part is the chatterer box. This is what it looks like inside. Unfortunately, the Kerbin race has not been able to make the TARDAK "bigger on the inside."
So a Tardis, I assume covered with solar panels, that is not quite larger on the inside? I think the doctor's gotten cheap
You sir have won one Internet. Here you go: +1

Very nice.

Is there any way we could get a .craft file? If we can, could you possibly remove the non-stock chatterbox, possibly having a stock and non-stock version for people?

T'would be much appreciated. I'd like to see what kind of stresses I could subject this thing to.

You got it. ;D Here's the file, perfectly stock. Only using the square probe, some batteries, some structural panels, solar panels, lights, an atmosphere gauge, and a decoupler at the bottom. Don't know why I kept the decoupler though. Enjoy!

http://www./?2erhil54tezbwff

Nicely done! Is it manned or probe-driven? Might be possible to make a 2.5m version with a landercan with custom kerbals inside.

That would take a lot of solar panels. T^T
This is hilarious, thanks! It definitely earned a +1 from me!
